thread.title: House Readies Votes on Bank-Deregulation Bill

author: Andrew Ackerman
title: House Readies Votes on Bank-Deregulation Bill
text:
WASHINGTONâ€”The House will soon vote on a Senate-approved bill to ease rules for small and midsize banks, House Speaker Paul Ryan (R., Wis.) said Tuesday, a move that would allow the bill to clear Congress and become law.
Passage of the measure would mark the most significant bipartisan overhaul of the financial rule book since Republicans took control of Washington last year, as well as the first major easing of the 2010 Dodd-Frank financial law. The House is also expected to advance a separate package of deregulatory measures...
